required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effect of Exercise on Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effect of Exercise on Vascular Function

brief_summary.textblock: The study objectives are the following: 1) To examine the acute vascular responses to continuous low- and moderate-intensity exercise and interval training; and 2) To examine the influence of age and gender on these responses.

detailed_description.textblock: The type, intensity and duration of exercise, fitness state, and timing of measurements have been reported to influence the acute vascular responses to exercise. However, little is known regarding the influence of interval training, aging and gender on these responses. The objectives of this study are: 1) to examine the acute vascular responses to continuous low- and moderate-intensity exercise and interval training; and 2) to examine the influence of age and gender on these responses. Subjects will perform the following 3 types of treadmill exercise in a random order: 1) slow-pace walking; 2) moderate-pace walking; and 3) interval training. Flow mediated dilation using high resolution ultrasonography and arterial stiffness using applanation tonometry will be measured before, immediately after and 1-hour after each acute bout of exercise.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 15 minutes after exercise and 1 hour after exercise
primary_outcome.description: Brachial artery endothelium-dependent flow-mediated dilation to reactive hyperemia will be measured using high resolution ultrasonography. Brachial artery diameter and blood velocity will be measured before and after occluding the forearm for 5 minutes by inflating a cuff to 250 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 15 minutes after exercise and 1 hour after exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial stiffness (aortic pulse wave velocity and augmentation index) will be measured using applanation tonometry.

arm_group.description: Subjects will complete 47 minutes of walking at slow pace.
Subjects will complete 47 minutes of walking at a moderate pace.
Subjects will complete 40 minutes of walking alternating between a moderate and fast pace.

intervention.description: Subjects will complete 47 minutes of walking on a treadmill at a slow-pace.
Subjects will complete 47 minutes of walking on a treadmill at a moderate pace.
Subjects will complete 40 minutes of walking on the treadmill alternating between a moderate and a fast pace.

study_pop.textblock: General population including men and women 18 to 79 years of age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women 18 to 79 years of age
- Women will be premenopausal or postmenopausal (either natural or surgical) defined as a cessation of menses for at least 2 years.
- Premenopausal women will be eumenorrheic.
- Able to give consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hepatic disease or infection with hepatitis B, C or HIV
- History of other relevant on-going or recurrent illness
- Recent (within 3 months) or recurrent hospitalizations
- Current intake of medications that may affect study results
- Use of tobacco products
- Premenopausal women taking oral contraceptives and postmenopausal women taking hormone replacement therapy.
- Pregnancy (positive urine pregnancy test) or lactation
- Perimenopausal women
